speaker: Skyline
text: Doppler Waves radiate from the tip of the Space Needle as if from a radio antenna.   **WHEN BAD THINGS HAPPEN TO GOOD BMW OWNERS**  _Scene One - Bus - Night As the bus pulls over, it makes a heavy splash.  The door opens, and Frasier and Roz step on.  Frasier is soaking wet._

speaker: Roz
text: Rule number one: always stand in back of the curb until the bus has come to a complete stop.  Now take your money and put it right in here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, thank you, Roz, but I am not completely lacking in street smarts. [_to the driver_] Good day, busman.  The northwest corner of Highland and 1st, please.

speaker: Driver
text: That's not a stop.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know. [_takes out a dollar bill_] Perhaps if I just shove a little encouragement into this box-

speaker: Roz
text: Come on!

speaker: Roz
text: Keep your eyes peeled for a seat, and hold on to a pole.

speaker: Frasier
text: Doesn't look very clean, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_looks down_] Well, would you rather wind up on the floor?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looks down_] Dear God! _As the last passengers board the bus, an attractive blond woman (Miranda) gets on and sits next to a brunette woman (Francine). Frasier is immediately captivated._

speaker: Miranda
text: [_British accent_] Francine!

speaker: Francine
text: Miranda!  Oh, long time.  How are things at the Colonnade?

speaker: Miranda
text: Oh, just for you, a mess.  Things have gotten so crazy there, they put me in charge.

speaker: Francine
text: Oh, that's great!  You deserve it.

speaker: Miranda
text: Oh, thank you.  How are you doing?

speaker: Roz
text: [_whispering_] Which one are you staring at?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not staring.  That would be rude.

speaker: Roz
text: Which one?

speaker: Frasier
text: Blonde.

speaker: Roz
text: Why don't you go over and talk to her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh please, Roz, come on, the woman's a perfect stranger.

speaker: Roz
text: Stranger?  You know her name, you know she has a job, you know she's attractive.  It's like an A&E; biography compared to what I used to know going in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, look at me - soaked through, hair's a mess.

speaker: Roz
text: Believe me, you could look a lot worse. _She gestures to the roof.  Frasier looks and sees an ad for his show, with an eye-patch and goatee inked over his portrait._

speaker: Frasier
text: After I specifically told people on the air not to do that!

speaker: Roz
text: Look, why don't you go over and talk to her?  It's not like you'll ever see her again if she shoots you down.

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps you're right.  What harm could it do? [_looks at her again_] My goodness - who would have thought that such a rare butterfly could exist in this tin cocoon?

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, for your information, plenty of refined, sophisticated women ride the bus every... Open your eyes, nimrod, that was my stop!

speaker: Roz
text: [_as she's leaving_] Good luck. _She gets off.  Frasier quickly sits down beside Miranda - cutting off a pregnant woman just getting on._

speaker: Miranda
text: Oh please, take mine.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gets up_] Oh, uh, you'd better take mine, too.  That way you can spread out.  Well, not that you need to spread out, actually, uh, well, right... it's my first time on a bus.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, Miss?  Uh, Miranda!  _He slips on the mess on the floor and goes down.  Miranda turns at the sound of her name, but sees nothing, and gets off the bus.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Apartment Martin is in his Armchair, on the phone._

speaker: Martin
text: Well Duke, how's the weather in Florida?  Eighty-two!  Oh, I sure envy you.  Yes, none of the rain here.  Yeah, Channel Four said it should clear up tomorrow, but the Channel Five guy said probably not till the weekend.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, then there's the Weather Channel.  Early-morning guy said it'll probably break by Saturday, but then the mid- morning guy... what do you mean, you got to go?  Shuffleboard? Oh come on, Duke, get a life!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Niles!  I thought you were working.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, the patient cancelled, so I thought I'd drop by and see you. [_breathless_] Oh my God, you have no idea how good it feels to say that!  I'm here to see _you_!  No more flimsy pretenses.  No more making tedious small talk with Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Niles, it's eighty-two in Florida!

speaker: Niles
text: Here to see Daphne, Dad!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'd better check on the roast in the oven.  It's three- seventy-five in there!

speaker: Martin
text: All right, no more weather talk.  Probably just getting a little stir-crazy from being cooped up for two weeks.  But won't be too much longer.  It'll all end with the meteor shower on Saturday, if you can believe those Channel Seven Doppler guys.  Ooh, I wonder what they're up to.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know that meteor shower we had a few years ago?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh please, don't remind me.  I was over here having dinner with Maris.  I will never forget that night.

speaker: Daphne
text: Neither will I.  I've never seen a person cut a caper in half.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I was out on the terrace witnessing this incredible display, and I was absolutely miserable.  Now I know it's because I would much rather have been sharing that moment with you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm here now.  Why don't we watch it together this Saturday?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Daphne, that's a wonderful idea!  We'll-we'll recreate the entire moment, right there on the terrace, right down to the last detail.  Except we'll be together.  And instead of serving the '92 Dom Perignon, we'll serve the '90, and we'll right _two_ horrible wrongs! _Frasier comes in, even wetter than before.  He angrily shakes out the skeletal ruin of his umbrella, then drops it in the wastebasket._

speaker: Martin
text: Wow.  Frasier, what happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: What happened?  I went six months without replacing my pollen filter in my car, so it was in the shop.  Couldn't get a cab, so I took the bus home.  Which splashed me!  And I fell down, missed my stop, and had to walk home ten blocks in this downpour!

speaker: Niles
text: You went _six months_ without changing your pollen filter?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Looks like you could use a spot of tea.

speaker: Frasier
text: Desperately!

speaker: Daphne
text: What'll it be, then?  I've got Earl Grey, English Breakfast, Chamomile, Orange Pekoe, Oolong, Lapsang Sou-

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake, just throw a bag in some hot water! [_pause_] Earl Grey.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Fras, I know it's not your thing, but Duke sent me a couple of tickets for tomorrow's Sonics game.  You want to go?

speaker: Frasier
text: I've got plans.

speaker: Martin
text: What plans?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just plans.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if you don't want to go, just tell me.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't want to go.

speaker: Martin
text: Would it kill you to spend one night with me?!

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake, I spend every night with you!  God knows, I have done my best to keep you entertained, but in the seven years since you've landed at my doorstep, have you ever known me once to show any interest in basketball?!

speaker: Niles
text: You know I'd go, Dad, but I have the quilt show.

speaker: Martin
text: Please Niles, I feel bad enough already.

speaker: Frasier
text: Care for a sherry, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you. [_Frasier pours two_] Little rough on Dad, weren't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I suppose so.  It's just been a rotten day.  You don't even know the topper -- there was an enchanting young woman on the bus.  Just when I'd worked up enough nerve to go and talk to her, I slipped on something that I can only hope was an old burrito!  Before I could manage to get up, she was gone.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I suppose it just wasn't meant to be.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait a minute.  You know, I did happen to overhear her name, and where she works.

speaker: Niles
text: Well then, what are you waiting for?  Seize the day!  You think I got together with Daphne by just sitting around?  Take a chapter from _my_ book.

speaker: Frasier
text: Exactly what chapter would that be?

speaker: Niles
text: [_admitting_] The last chapter.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Suppose I did go and talk with her?  What would I say? "I spied on you on the bus, and I've managed to hunt you down here where you work, would you care to have dinner sometime?" I might as well just lop off my ear and mail it to her.

speaker: Niles
text: No, just pretend you're there on business.  Where does she work?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a retirement home.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh... oh, well, uh, tell her you're there looking for someplace for Dad.  In fact, bring him along for cover.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, you know how he hates those places.  He'd never agree to it.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, he doesn't need to.  Just take him to the game tomorrow, and make an unannounced stop on the way.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you're suggesting that I-I go crawling back to Dad, beg him to let me take him to the basketball game, use him to meet a pretty girl, and sit through a sport I loathe.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I see your point.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm just trying to get the sequence right. [_heads to the kitchen_] Oh, Dad! _FADE TO:  Scene Three - The Colonnade The foyer of the retirement home.  Frasier leads Martin through the door._

speaker: Martin
text: You could have told me we were stopping here when we left for the game.

speaker: Frasier
text: If you'd known that, you never would have agreed to come.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you didn't have to trick me.  I mean, I would never do anything like that to you.

speaker: Frasier
text: It seems someone is forgetting sending Niles and me off to Boy Scout Camp to earn our "Opera Badges!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, there she is!  All right, now listen, remember, you're interested in living here.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, but I don't want to be late for the game.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, uh, I'm Frasier Crane, this is my father Martin.

speaker: Miranda
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: We're interested in finding out a bit more about the Colonnade. Is there someone we could talk to?

speaker: Miranda
text: Oh well, I'm the director here, Miranda Rogers.  Um, why don't I get you a couple of brochures, and if you like what you see, you can fill out an application.

speaker: Martin
text: Application?

speaker: Miranda
text: It only takes about twenty minutes.

speaker: Martin
text: Twenty minutes?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Dad, application, twenty minutes. [_to Miranda_] He likes to repeat things, it's a soothing mechanism. [_strokes Martin's hair, speaking carefully_] Twenty-minutes, twenty-minutes.

speaker: Miranda
text: You're very patient with him.  I'll be right back.

speaker: Martin
text: You didn't say I'd have to put anything in writing.  You haven't even seen her before, have you?  You're trying to put me in here for real!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm not!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you said you met her on the bus, I knew that story was full of holes!

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake, will you just stop it?  No one's going to put you anywhere!

speaker: Martin
text: You're damn right they're not, because I'm not filling out any application!  So will you hurry up and make your date, and let's get off this ice floe!

speaker: Miranda
text: You know, I'm starting a tour in a few minutes, it'd be a good way to get your questions answered.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's a splendid idea.

speaker: Martin
text: A tour?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Dad, a tour. [_strokes his hair again_] A-tour.  Now come along.  _Martin gives him a very hooded look.  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene Four - The Colonnade - Later Miranda leads the tour group back into the foyer, the Cranes bringing up the rear._

speaker: Miranda
text: As you can see, we're a full service facility...

speaker: Martin
text: Will you hurry up and ask her?  If we move any slower in this place they're gonna start harvesting our organs!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right!  It's kind of difficult with all these people around.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, the game's already started.  Two minutes, and I'm calling a cab.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right. _He heads to the front of the group.  An elderly resident (Lee) notices Martin._

speaker: Lee
text: Hey, I know you.  McGinty's, right?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, Marty Crane.

speaker: Lee
text: Yeah, Lee Zeppowitz.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Lee.

speaker: Lee
text: Hey, we could really use a fourth for poker, if you're moving in.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh jeez, no, I'm sorry.  I'm just here to do a favor for my son.  We're on our way over to the ballgame.

speaker: Lee
text: Uh-huh.  They told me I was going to the Space Needle.  _He leaves.  Martin gets a suspicious look on his face.  Frasier has managed to get Miranda alone._

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks for the tour.

speaker: Miranda
text: Oh, you're welcome.  If you have any more questions, don't hesitate to ask.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well actually, you know, I do have, uh, one more question, um... do you think it'd be possible to have dinner sometime?

speaker: Miranda
text: Oh, sure.  Um, come by with your father around five tomorrow and I'll set you up at the cafeteria.  I should warn you tomorrow's steak night, so be prepared to throw a few elbows! [_laughs_] And you just asked me out on a date, didn't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but that was before I knew it was steak night.

speaker: Miranda
text: Sure, why not?  Um, how about this weekend?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's-that's great.  Uh, I'll-I'll call you.

speaker: Miranda
text: Okay.  Um, you know, I-I don't normally date people I've just met, but you seem like such a nice person.  I can tell by the way you are with your father.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, we're very close.  _He heads out the door, mission accomplished.  Miranda notices Martin is still waiting at the desk.  Frasier rushes back in._

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Dad, I checked and the rain's letting up a bit.  _They leave.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Five - Apartment - Night The apartment is made up in date mode.  The doorbell rings.  Frasier comes out in his best suit, picks up the remote control for the stereo, and turns on some soft music.  Swaying to the tune, he opens the door -- to Niles, carrying a champagne bottle._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  What are you doing here?

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne and I are watching the meteor shower on the terrace.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, you're not, I have a date! [_turns off the stereo_]

speaker: Niles
text: That's tonight?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Well-well-well, what are we gonna do?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.  Uh, go to the roof.

speaker: Niles
text: We can't do that, we're having a recreation!  _Daphne comes out of the kitchen, wearing a nice dress with a shawl over her shoulders, carrying a picnic basket._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you'll never believe this.  Frasier wants to send us to the roof!

speaker: Daphne
text: What a romantic idea.

speaker: Niles
text: [_grins to cover_] Isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, it's very romantic, now get your crap and go! Coming, coming!

speaker: Niles
text: Where'd you put Dad, in storage?

speaker: Frasier
text: I have no idea where Dad is.  All I know is that he's not here, and you are!

speaker: Miranda
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good evening, Miranda.  Come in.  Uh, I'd like to introduce you to my brother, Niles Crane.

speaker: Miranda
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: And this is Daphne Moon-

speaker: Miranda
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: His... lady friend.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I suppose I am!  _As they chatter giddily, Frasier shoves them out the door and closes it._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm so sorry, my brother's not very social, really.  Uh, here we are. [_shows her in_] Would you care for some wine?

speaker: Miranda
text: Oh, I'd love some, yeah.  Oh, you have a beautiful place!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Miranda
text: [_sees the Armchair_] Ah, something tells me this must be your father's chair.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, you know, I insisted that he bring it with him when he moved in here.  I mean, after all, this is his home too.

speaker: Miranda
text: How thoughtful of you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Miranda
text: Well, I imagine he'll be bringing that with him when he moves in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, Miranda, you know, I've got to be honest with you, uh... as much as I like the Colonnade, I'm not sure Dad's really ready to move in yet.

speaker: Miranda
text: Well then, I guess he hasn't told you.  Your father filled out an application today.

speaker: Frasier
text: Application?  My father?  Today?

speaker: Miranda
text: Sounds like he's moving out just in time, you're picking up that repeating thing. **BETTER A WINDSHIELD THAN HIS TEETH**  _Scene Six - Elliot Bay Towers Roof Niles and Daphne are sitting on a blanket on the roof with their picnic basket._

speaker: Niles
text: You know, I've been giving a lot of thought to this idea of a pet name for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_hopeful_] And you've decided to give it up?

speaker: Niles
text: No, I don't give up that easily... "Woggles."

speaker: Niles
text: I was kidding.  You're not really a "Woggles."  You're more of a "Cuddles."  No, I was kidding again!  Someone stop me!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_re: basket_] Well, what have we got in here, then?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, oh well, we have the finest champagne, and beluga caviar... [_lifts out a plate of peanut brittle_] oh, and broken bits of pottery.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's peanut brittle.  I made it myself so we could have something sweet.  Try some.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh well, I hardly need something sweet with you here.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, [_kisses him_] you are such a dear. [_no-nonsense_] Seriously, try some. _Niles puts a small piece in his mouth.  From the way he screws up his face, we can see something ghastly's going on in his mouth, but he's trying hard not to show it._

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm.  Oh...

speaker: Daphne
text: Is it good?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it's like little shards of heaven.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh dear!  The wind's picked up.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh dear!  I hope nothing else blows away! _She goes to retrieve the plates.  While her back's turned, he cocks his arm and flings the peanut brittle off the roof.  She turns back._

speaker: Daphne
text: What happened to the peanut brittle?

speaker: Niles
text: It blew away!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'll run and get some books to hold this cloth down. _He goes through the open stairway door.  Daphne takes the cinder block holding the door open and puts it on the blanket._  _CUT TO: inside the Stairwell The door slams shut, trapping Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: What happened?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_from behind the door_] I moved the block to hold down the blanket and [_tries the door_] now the door seems to be stuck.

speaker: Niles
text: [_tries it himself, no luck_] All right, uh, Daphne, you sit tight, I'll run and get the super, he'll have it open in a minute.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right.  _Niles steps down the stairs and pushes the door at the bottom. It doesn't budge.  He tries it again, with a tinge of panic._

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, where's the key to the stairway door?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I've got it.  I'll slide it under.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, all right.  No problem, take your time, no need to panic.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, dear.  There is no under.  It's sealed tight.

speaker: Niles
text: Sealed?  All right, now Daphne, [_breathing faster_] try and remain calm.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, we'll just have to wait for the night watchman. He checks all these doors when he does his rounds in a few hours.

speaker: Niles
text: [_hyperventilating_] For the last time, Daphne, I told you not to panic, and so you don't make me say it again, I have to conserve oxygen! _He closes one nostril with his finger, breathing only through the other one.  FADE TO:  Scene Seven - The Colonnade Martin is playing seven-card stud in the foyer with Lee and two other residents.  Frasier comes in._

speaker: Lee
text: Hey look, Marty, there's your son.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, nice try, like I'd take my eyes off you while you're dealing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, can I have a word with you for a second?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Fras!  Yeah, all right.  Uh, keep going, guys, I'm in.

speaker: Martin
text: What happened to your date?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, suffice it to say it didn't go so well.  Spent the whole time worried about you.  Listen, I-I came down to apologize.  I've been selfish, and I've neglected you, and I'm sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh well, apology accepted, son.  We've both been a little cranky, it's probably just the rain.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad, listen, listen, I want us to go to games together, I really do.  And I want us to see movies, and go drinking at McGinty's-

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's great, son.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad, Dad, I'm trying to say something here.  I'm not ready for you to leave.

speaker: Frasier
text: I-I don't want you to move in here.  I miss you too much. Please, Dad, come home.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, what the hell are you talking about?  I'm not moving in here.

speaker: Frasier
text: But Miranda told me you filled out an application, that you told her you'd found a new home.

speaker: Martin
text: [_lowers voice_] Well, I had to.  It's the only way to stay in the game, it's for residents only.

speaker: Frasier
text: This was just a-a ruse so you could continue playing poker?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's not just poker, it's poker with the three worst players I've ever seen!

speaker: Lee
text: Hey Marty, you in?  Sid's got a pair of tens showing.

speaker: Martin
text: Look at me, Sid!

speaker: Martin
text: Raise you twenty. [_to Frasier_] You dream about getting in games like this all your life, but you never think it's gonna happen!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Dad, please, I can't let you go on taking advantage of these people!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm not taking advantage of them, I'm-I'm giving them an education!  Consider it, uh, an expensive seminar.

speaker: Frasier
text: Seminar, my eye!  Now you're gonna give every cent of that money back to those men!

speaker: Martin
text: [_sighs_] All right.  I'll let them win it back.

speaker: Lee
text: Come on, Marty, you in?

speaker: Martin
text: [_sits down_] All right, yeah, I'm in.  Let's see -- oh, Lee's got a pair of aces, whoa!  And three tens here!  What have I got?  Four, five, seven... ah well, I'll just bet it all.

speaker: Lee
text: Too rich for my blood.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll leave the light on for you, Dad.  _Frasier leaves.  FADE TO:  Scene Eight - Elliot Bay Towers Roof Daphne is sitting against the door, with the blanket wrapped around her shoulders._

speaker: Daphne
text: How are you holding up?  Is that spider still around?  _CUT TO: Stairwell Niles is huddled into a ball next to the door._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I think he's realized he's more afraid of me than I am of him... [_looks up_] He's not in his corner!  He's not in his corner!  Oh, there it is, found him.  _CUT TO: Roof Daphne eats a cracker with caviar._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Daphne, you must be starving.  Please, please, don't wait for me, you go ahead and eat.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_tries to sound empty-mouthed_] You sure? [_looks up_] Oh, I just saw one!

speaker: Niles
text: A spider?!

speaker: Daphne
text: No, a meteor!  Oh, it's beautiful!  It just appeared out of nowhere!

speaker: Niles
text: That's it, that's it!  I missed it the last time, I'm not gonna let it happen again!  Daphne, stand back, this door is coming down!  _He charges up the stairs and rams his shoulder into the door -- nothing, except pain._  _CUT TO: Roof Daphne stands away from the door.  She didn't even hear him hit._

speaker: Daphne
text: Okay, I'm ready!  Oh, I just saw another one!  Oh, it's breathtaking!  It just streaked from one end of the sky to the other!  Oh Niles, I wish you could see this.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, so do I, my love.

speaker: Daphne
text: What did you just call me?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh well, it was kind of a place-filler.  I didn't have time to think of a good one.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I-I like it... "My love."  It's nice.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I just saw another one!

speaker: Niles
text: What's it look like?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's got a long, glittering tail.  It reminds me of the time my father drove home from the pub with a trashcan stuck underneath his car.  Sparks were flying everywhere!  Did I ever tell you that story?

speaker: Niles
text: No, you never did... my love.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, my father stopped in at the pub on his way home from work...  _CUT TO: Stairwell Niles rests his head against the door and smiles.  He has everything he needs.  END OF ACT TWO_
